title: Spiced Chicken and Pearl Barley Soup
description: This is one of this meals you want to eat when in need of something nourishing and hot. I like to make it for two people then freeze the rest in tupperware for when you’re in need of a virtuous meal. Swap the cooked pearl barley for orzo, faro or giant cous cous. You could even add a drained can of chickpeas or butterbeans instead, just add them in at the end (after step 4) and heat through for an extra 5-10 minutes.
ingredients: 150g cooked pearl barley (or faro, giant cous cous, orzo - or even a can of butterbeans/chickpeas would be delicious and healthy)
method: Heat a large pan with 1-2 tbsp of olive oil over a high heat. When the pan is hot, add 2 sliced celery sticks, 1 sliced onion and a pinch of salt then sweat for 15 minutes, until it has begun to soften and sweeten.
Add the spices (1 tbsp cumin, 1/2 tbsp turmeric, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tbsp smoked paprika), 2 cloves of chopped garlic and 1 tbsp of tomato puree. Cook out for two minutes, stirring frequently.

Add the chicken drumsticks, 250g chopped potato, chicken stock and 500g batoned carrots. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes (or until then chicken is cooked through).

At this point I like to remove the drumsticks and half of the carrots then whizz up the rest of the soup so the soup has a slightly thicker mouthfeel. However, if you like a more stock like soup with chunks of veg, then don’t bother to puree the soup!

Stir through pearl barley and serve piping hot. I like to serve the soup with some chopped coriander and harissa, but this aren’t necessary additions. A spoonful of yoghurt and some toasted seeds would also be delicious.
